content: this legal text summarizes a court case that took place in rome regarding the division of assets in an inheritance case the court determined the value of various movable properties and declared that they should be divided equally among the heirs the court also ordered the dissolution of the hereditary community and the division of the movable properties into five lots any remaining balances were assigned to the respective assignees compensation was ordered for the occupation of a flat in rome the court addressed the issue of collation determining the amounts each heir should contribute the court reserved the right to draw lots for further requests the remaining assets including furniture and credits were divided equally among the heirs compensation was also ordered for the occupation of another property the court concluded that it did not have jurisdiction over the dissolution of a community property located in spain the court made several other orders and decisions regarding the case
